snippet: The move could set up a test of whether Congress may make conspiracy, not recognized as a war crime, something able to be prosecuted in a war-crimes tribunal.
abstract: Prosecutors for the military commission trials at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, say they have added a charge of conspiracy against Iraqi detainee Abd al Hadi al Iraqi; move potentially sets up a test of whether Congress has the power to make conspiracy a prosecutable offense in a war-crimes tribunal despite its not being recognized as an international war crime.
lead_paragraph: The move could set up a test of whether Congress may make conspiracy, not recognized as a war crime, something able to be prosecuted in a war-crimes tribunal.

headline.main: Guantánamo Bay Prosecutors Accuse Detainee of Conspiracy
headline.print_headline: Guantánamo Bay Prosecutors Accuse Detainee of Conspiracy

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
